BBSolBrain1: ^It wasn’t easy at first to come up with ideas without immediately thinking about the pros and cons.
BBSolBrain2: ^When I look at my obstacles, my mind jumps straight back to the same old ideas I've tried before.
BBSolBrain3: ^Playing the brainstorming games helped put me in the creative mindset to think beyond what I’ve tried before.
BBSolBrain4: ^I surprised myself with how many potential solutions I came up with once I just the possibilties flow.
BowenSolBrain1: ^I’m an ideas guy, so this is the part of problem-solving I have fun with.
BowenSolBrain2: ^Sometimes I come up with ideas faster than I can write them down, so I used my phone to record my brainstorming and then translate it to text in my journal.
BowenSolBrain3: ^I got all of the potential solutions down that came to mind, but I wanted to explore other angles too.
BowenSolBrain4: ^I tried imagining some of the ways my Dad would approach this problem. He’s more of a practical guy, so we think very differently, but he’s the best problem-solver I know.
BowenSolBrain5: ^This helped me see the situation from a different perspective.
BowenSolBrain6: ^Some ideas I came up with are:
JenSolBrain1: ^It took me a few tries to really tap into my creativity.
JenSolBrain2: ^I have a habit of jumping to big, unrealistic “solutions” and being disappointed in myself when they don’t work out.
JenSolBrain3: ^I had to practice slowing down and looking for the common themes across my ideas.
JenSolBrain4: ^Once I sorted my ideas into categories, I realized that I had a lot of strategies, but not very many tactics for putting those strategies into action.
